data.title: Best Beignets this is of NOLA
data.text: The Poor Porker is an eclectic mix of chicory coffee, beignets and southwestern gardens. Hispter chic with free wifi and atmosphere to spare, well worth a try. The signature  "Poor Porker" beignets are maple bacon goodness and simply divine! Nighttime offers a whole new appeal.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Went here to try the beignets, the place it's magical. Made from scratch, big open space lovely decorated with things and furniture that other people discard for not needing or being useful. Great place to relax and enjoy a sweet treat.  Definitely recommend and returning.

data.title: If you are not familiar with the French doughnut
data.text: Saw a place that was closed, looked at the website. Everyone was enjoying the fare, saw the owner spooning meat and saying the thing in his hand was covered with pig. My bad. Went there with a taste for a small meat pie. My misunderstanding, but I won't even go back to try the coffee.

data.title: Get in your car and GO!!! NOW!
data.text: Beignets are DELICIOUS! It is an outdoor venue, so plan on sitting outside (summer is HOT in Floirda) but there is an indoor seating area.

data.title: Strange but you must go there.
data.text: Owner is a sculptor who has a twist or twisted mind with interesting sculptures, ie. 1/2 a car overflowing with flowers. A piano with a similar look. Good beignets with an interesting cappacino that was terrific. Go for the food and a laugh in an area where it doesn't look like it fits.

data.title: First visit to Poor Porker
data.text: What a cool place to see and experience. The beignets were delicious and the atmosphere was nice! A must see and enjoy the casual atmosphere!

data.title: Breakfast...lunch or hang out
data.text: Delicious fresh ... strong coffee... great admosphere .... their decorations are unique... also in weekends is Maggies food..sometimes music...wine us available

data.title: Very cool place!
data.text: Took my 15 year old daughter here and she loved it! We got traditional beignets and two iced coffees, both were flawless. There are many little nooks and cool places to sit and hangout. The owner was there as well and he is one nice guy! They have an amazing story and it's really great that Lakeland has a place like this.

data.title: Best Beignets this side of New Orleans
data.text: Today's special was the Pina Colada beignet with a cream of coconut drizzle and fresh diced pineapple.  They always have traditional - powdered sugar, brown butter caramel and their signature Poor Porker beignets with crumbled smoked bacon and a maple syrup beignet.  Open Thursday thru Sunday.  Entertainment some nights, karaoke and story telling others.  Great hot & cold brew coffee, soft drinks and beer and wine evenings.  Fun environment - don't be in a rush - every order is made fresh hot and for you.

data.title: Creative tasty and a happy place
data.text:
I've visited this incredible establishment a number of times. I am so excited for Lakeland to have somethings of this caliber and creativeness in town. I would describe it best as Santa Cruz, CA meets Asheville, NC. It is not just a place to refuel the body but also the mind and spirit. 
I have ridden there on my bike and asked to just bring it on inside. Very friendly knowledge outgoing staff. 
The Mommy's have found it. With a great park nearby it is a fun place to bring the kids and let them explore. I also like it on quiet Sunday mornings for reflection time. It offers live music on certain weekend nights for an all together different ambiance. 
It is a fun place to meet friends, go on a first date, or wind down by myself. 
The ice coffee and beignets are awesome. I would love to see the menu expand a little with some healthier options, but a sugar buzz is called for now and then.

data.title: Eclectic and fun!
data.text: A cool place like no other in Lakeland. Unique outdoor seating: dine in a vintage travel trailer or in a teepee! The succulents grow out of an old piano and create a beautiful setting for the booths. This place can be romantic just as well as the perfect spot to take the family. The food is unusual and tasty.

data.title: New visit
data.text: Unique fun environment. Very entertaining despite the brew hub beer list. Powdered beignets are ridiculous even late at evening.

data.title: A must...
data.text: We went on a Sat. It's unique, nice atmosphere, and I love the cold coffee. There was a guitarist playing and singing for tips. Now my children keep bugging me to go again! You'll love it!

data.title: yummerz!
data.text: Best breakfast around! Awesome hipster atmosphere! Fun seating areas, very creative and resourceful place to visit!

data.title: Can't wait to come back.
data.text: I came here for a few drinks, and the places is awesome.  It is nice having a something refreshing in Lakeland.  This is not your typical place!!!  And I like it.

data.title: Unique atmosphere awaits in this succulent garden
data.text: This is an open air, unique place. Best beignets this side of NOLA! Great place to sit and have a cup of campfire coffee (hot or cold). This place is just marvelous to walk around and explore on a Sunday afternoon. New concept with use of food trucks in a more permanent setting. Limited menu but keeps what they do have top quality & fresh. The venue is near Lake Mirror. Its a walk up gem hidden behind the gates. From what I hear they have local bands on weekends and the BBQ good literally rolls in when available. Alcohol can be purchased  in one of the buildings. Wholesome snacks in another shed. Local artisian style  candles, jewelry, and more in another location. Such a fun place. Must see! Can't wait to return to this main street location to enjoy music, bbq & beignets!

data.title: very cool ~
data.text:
wonderful atmosphere, boho unique, coffee, dessert. 
A gathering of unique little stands selling natural foods, BBQ, wine/bar, and gifts.

data.title: Try the beignets
data.text: Try the beignets.  Cozy atmosphere.  Friendly place.  Slow service, you have to wait in line to order and receive your dessert.  Very busy place, not enough seating.  Well decorated.  Beignets were delicious, and made before our eyes. Recommended.

data.title: AN OASIS FOR HIPSTERS, HIPPIES, ARTISTS… AND YOU
data.text:
This artistic oasis came out of nowhere- it’s only a block from Lake Mirror! From the outside it looks like a junk yard, but we were squealing with amusement once we passed the gates. Whimsy art décor, a teepee to relax inside, dozens of varied seating areas, fire pit, garden… 

THE COFFEE AND BEIGNETS TRUCK
This was the only thing open during my visit. Unfortunately, they don’t offer Espresso-based drinks. Simple Coffee. That and Beignets which were amazing! Our Caramel and Powdered Sugar Beignets were fresh from the fryer and incredibly soft yet filling. The dough tasted great even without the toppings! My tiny gripe is the price- the Coffee was regular (relatively plain) yet were priced at $3 or $4 depending on the size. That’s too much for plain Coffee.

BUT THE SERVICE AND ENVIRONMENT NEED A RETURN VISIT
Any staff we ran into—in the Coffee Truck on watering the garden—was really enthusiastic about their work. I’d love to return on an evening when they have acoustic or poetry performances. This place seems like it would gather great minds in a cool environment.
